texts.text: Now, let's go back to the pie chart where you can see the impact of the reclassification showing a too high decrease  primarily in General Vacuum market and an acceleration in Refrigeration, Air Conditioning, Automotive. Now,  let's go into details market-by-market. I'll start with the most prominent one, the Semi & Vacuum Coating,  formerly known as Specific Vacuum Process Industries market, on slide number six, which still includes the same  submarkets or applications as always, namely, Solar, Display, Optics, and Semiconductor manufacturers. Sales to  customers of this market increased 4% year-over-year, but slowed down by 1% sequentially. There have been four  main developments that I'd like to highlight.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Third remark, it became very clear by now that the OLED display technology will replace the LCD flat panel  technology, especially for mobile devices. Investment plans of large Korean display manufacturers as well as large  Chinese government-owned conglomerates indicate a boom over the next two years. Our products are used to  control the vacuum coating processes, and we sell the products to the equipment as well as the display  manufacturers. Even a small amount of process-critical consumables from INFICON will be used. And my last  comment is regarding the solar market, where we see a small silver line at the horizon and experience an increase  in all the volume of products to be used in equipments to produce photovoltaic solar panels, especially from  Chinese customers.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Security threats caused by unstable political situations in many regions around the world are still the main driver  of the renewed interest from government and non-government customers. The need for onsite detection of  unknown, especially dangerous chemical gases, is essential to protect people, soldiers, firefighters, and scientists  for all kinds of different applications. Our product is also used for petrochemical, environmental, and public utility  applications. Soon, we are going to have a full line of gas pipeline leak detectors to control and survey the  distribution networks in cities. First sales of the new IRwin products to German cities have been made in the first  quarter of this year, and we just started to expand distribution network to other European countries.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Now, moving to the Refrigeration, Air Conditioning, and Automotive markets on slide number eight. We've  experienced a sales decrease – increase of over 20% year-over-year. The exact figure is a little bit lower due to the  customer reclassification. The increase can be allocated to the Automotive and after-sales service market, while  the market for Refrigeration and Air Conditioning manufactures shows saturation indications, especially in China.  We really enjoy our leading market share position in the markets for Refrigeration and Air Conditioning  manufactures. But if this market doesn't grow anymore, our growth potentials are limited. Therefore, years ago,  we decided to study the Automotive market and developed dedicated products to fulfill the needs for more  stringent tightness requirements for more and more components to be used in cars. In the meantime, we reached  an annual sales volume of more than $20 million in the Automotive market and expect a double-digit growth rate  in the years to come.

texts.speaker: Matthias Tröndle
texts.profession: CFO, Vice President & Head-Investor Relations
texts.text: Looking at the development, all markets except the General Vacuum market increased. The Refrigeration, Air  Conditioning, and Automotive markets increased by strong 23%, and the Security & Energy market increased by  64%. On a sequential basis, sales in the first quarter were lower by 2% than the sales recorded in previous quarter  Q4. This was mainly driven by lower sales to the Security & Energy market.

The growth was  clearly driven by Asian customers, with investments in leak checking applications for the automotive market. The  majority of our shipments still went to traditional car component manufacturers to make sure they fulfill the  increasing tougher specifications for air and liquid tightness. Environmental regulations, fuel efficiency, and safety  requirements, are the main targets to be met with leak free component.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Safety concerns are the major factor of the second growth driver in the automotive market or, more specific, the  lithium-ion batteries used in an increasing fleet of electric vehicles need to be perfectly hermetically sealed before  they can be installed in those cars. Especially Chinese battery makers invest in additional manufacturing capacity  with increased step-by-step leak checking capabilities, mostly from INFICON. Additionally, we continue to expand  our distribution network for our line of after-sales products outside of the U.S. and serve more private label  customers enjoy – and enjoy a nice growth year-over-year.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Last, but not least, we have established now a fully dedicated team to focus on food packaging applications in the  German speaking part of Europe to sell the new Contura S400 leak detector into food packaging applications.

Refrigeration, Air  Conditioning & Automotive market increased by 6%, and the General Vacuum market increased a second time in  a row and showed a growth of 8%. Only Security & Energy market had a weak start due to lower U.S. sales and  decreased by 17%.

texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG

The growing e-car activities need new and improved batteries; and the battery manufacturing capacity is  behind the demand, which will generate new leak tracking opportunities for INFICON.

texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Those newly-acquired technologies will also enable the development of a new family of gas analyzers using a  single sensor, as well as a combination of several different sensor types combined in a single product using new  firm and software platform. This new concept will be the basis for customer-specific product developments within  a very short time to allow customers to find and verify dedicated specific gas molecules.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Moving to the refrigeration and air conditioning, or RAC, market on slide number 8, sales there increased –  decreased, sorry, 5% year-over-year as well as sequentially. We continue to dominate this niche market but we  experienced a more challenging market environment in China where we see some manufacturing capacity  saturation. On the positive side, we enjoy a market recovery in the US, Southeast Asia, as well as Eastern  Europe. We continue to gain market share in the industrial and automotive leak detection market. The acquisition  of the hydrogen leak detection technology enables us to get access to a broader range of leak detection  applications. Customers around the world like our products and the INFICON leak detectors are the premier  products for all RAC quality testing applications. And we are on the way to reach a similar market position in the  industrial and automotive market. Our state-of-the-art patented products enable customers to cope with tighter  specifications and change regulations for more environmental friendliness and lower power consumption.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Furthermore, we have the right hand-held battery power tools to provide the after sales service for installed air  conditioners and refrigerators and, in the future, for more automotive applications as well. We continue to explore  attractive new markets for INFICON technology in a variety of new applications such as packaging or public utility  industry.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: The use of the award winning WISE, the acquired hydrogen, as well as new to-be-developed technology allows  us the design of new products for new applications in growing markets. We just successfully launched a new  OEM leak detector module, the LDS 3000 for system integrator customers to build highly sophisticated, fully- automated equipment to ensure 100% quality check for tight components in the automotive and industrial market.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Although this market shows a temporary weakness, we believe there will be huge investments in manufacturing  capacity needed once we are going to replace the traditional light bulbs with brighter, more natural and more  energy efficient LED light devices.

texts.speaker: Matthias Tröndle
texts.profession: Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Emergency response and security markets had a good quarter with sales of $6.5 million compared with $4.1  million in last year's second quarter, an increase of 59%. As mentioned by Mr. Winkler, the sales performance  was driven by our sales – higher sales to Asian and Americas customers, mainly in military and environmental  industry. Sequentially, compared to first quarter, which was the highest quarterly sales level for that market so far,  second quarter sales decreased by 23%, driven by lower sales in Asia.

file: IFCN - Q2 2013 Earnings Call 8August2013 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 08-Aug-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: In our first quarter earnings call, we talked about the focus shift from water to air pollution issues in China,  especially in Beijing. That had a negative impact on our business, since we focused more on water quality  measurement. From a long-term perspective, that's actually a good news, because it will increase our  opportunities in the air monitoring market, since the water pollution issues are not going to disappear.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: The list of interesting projects include the energy and energy distribution market, especially in the US and later on  eventually in the rest of the world where gas and oil will be explored by applying the hydro-fracking method. We  currently spend time and money to investigate how exactly and where our INFICON technology could be used in  this new market. Based on the current backlog and the hot projects that we are aware of, we expect the second  half year to be at a substantial higher level. Additionally, we soon start to ship the recently launched new Micro  GC product line, that product together with our nice line of handheld gas analyzers will support our efforts to gain  market share in the industrial and petrochemical markets.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Moving to the Refrigeration & Air Conditioning, or RAC market on slide number 7, sales were stable compared to  the same quarter a year ago and increased 8% on a sequential basis, mainly due to stronger sales to Asian  customers. We continue to be the preferred number one supplier on the pure RAC market. And we did gain some  market share in the adjacent industrial and automotive leak detection markets. The Chinese RAC market  remained challenging with ongoing saturation indication. And in the US market, we experienced a continuation of  the helium shortage, which customers being on allocation. That opened new opportunities and we successfully  sell a new product that can easily replace the traditional helium-based technology by a highly sophisticated, but  quite easy to handle hydrogen leak detector.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Other positive elements, our market share gains in industrial and automotive leak detection market in all regions  around the world. Our state-of-the-art and patented products enable customers to cope with tighter specifications  and change regulations for more environmental friendliness and lower power consumption. We continue to  explore attractive new markets for INFICON technology in a variety of new applications, such as the food  packaging or public utility industry.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: In May, this year we actually presented the first-in-line food packaging leak detector at a meat packaging  tradeshow in Germany. The concept of this product has been very well received and we demonstrated that we  can provide the leak integrity of more than 100 packaged food per minute. We will ship the first unit for [ph] better  site (00:06:39) testing to customers before the end of this year. And if we are successful, we start marketing this  new product soon after.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: In the Specific Vacuum Process Industries market, which does include solar, display, optics and semiconductor  manufacturers on slide number 8, INFICON sales decreased 10% year-over-year, but were stable compared to  the previous quarter, mainly driven by solid sales to customers in the optics market and a slight recovery in the  semiconductor equipment market, but slightly lower sales to semiconductor chip makers. Sales to LCD display  and solar photovoltaic customers remained low.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: We just introduced a record number of new products at the SEMICON West trade show in San Francisco a month  ago and all of them have been very well received. They enabled the customers to reduce their cost, increase their  efficiency and increase their output yields. In the portable type solar market, we can only see a very small light at  the end of the tunnel.

texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Let me start with the development in the Specific Vacuum process industries market, which does include solar,  display, optics, and semiconductor manufacturers, on slide number 6. We finished the quarter at the same sales  level as a year ago, but the sales breakdown changed.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Additionally, we see further business for our gas analysis core competence in the field of energy production and  distribution, especially in the US where oil and gas hydrofracking technologies became very prominent. texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Now, moving to the Refrigeration & Air Conditioning or RAC market, on slide number 8, sales increased more  than 10% year-over-year as well as sequentially. We continue to be the preferred number one supplier in the pure  RAC market. And, again, we gained market share in the automotive leak detection and adjacent industrial  markets. Customers in Asia placed more orders, and we enjoyed increased investments in new and upgraded  manufacturing capacity for RAC devices and automotive parts.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: With our full line of helium, hydrogen, refrigerant and multi-gas leak detection instruments, sensors and modules,  we can fulfill almost all customer needs for their quality inspection and leak tightness applications. Our products  are used at all levels of the manufacturing process from component to subassembly testing, final inspection, as  well as service and repair activities.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: We develop, manufacture and sell the most complete range of leak testing devices starting with an inexpensive  relatively simple handheld instrument up to a high-end, very sensitive multi-gas detection unit. Together with our  experienced sales and support teams, as well as a worldwide service infrastructure, we are best positioned to  help customers solving their leak problems and support them to reach their quality goals.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: With a high market share in our focus markets, we are faced with limited growth opportunities. Therefore, we  continue to explore attractive new markets for INFICON technology in a variety of new applications outside the  traditional markets. We are already very active in the automotive market and will soon enter the public utility  market with a natural gas leak finder. Additionally in 2015, we are going to launch a leak detector for the food  packaging market.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Inficon Holding AG
texts.text: We continue to explore attractive new markets for INFICON technology in a variety of new applications in different  industries with the award-winning Wise Technology, the acquisition of the Cumulative Helium Leak Detector  technology from Pernicka at the end of 2010, and the recent acquisition of the hydrogen leak detection business  from Pfeiffer Vacuum. Now, we are able to offer an alternative gas leak checking method to helium, especially for  higher [ph] liquids (00:07:12) in the public utilities, automotive and fuel cell technology markets, as well as for  customers who do not want to deal with the relatively expensive helium as a test gas.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Inficon Holding AG
texts.text: And this Specific Vacuum Process Industries market which does include solar, display, optics and semiconductor  manufacturers on slide number 9, INFICON sales increased year-over-year by 12% but decreased 8% over the  previous quarter, mainly driven by equipment manufacturer in the semiconductor and photovoltaic solar business  in the US, Japan, and China. Nevertheless, the global trend for mobile communication, being continuously  connected with the world wherever you are, continues.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Inficon Holding AG
texts.text: Improved energy efficiencies and better displays drove and will drive investments in OLED and LED and optics  and other thin film-making coating technologies. Despite the increased uncertainty, investments in technology for  semiconductor alternative and green energy marketing trends are not going to stop. In the worst case, we will see  as postponement or moved projects.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Inficon Holding AG
texts.text: The long-term perspective in these dedicated INFICON focus markets are very healthy. And with our state-of-the- art instruments like the just introduce new Quantus Gas Analyzer, which is an optical emissions [ph] spectroscopy  (00:09:09) sensor, and our new ceramic coated pressure sensors, as well as our global infrastructure and already  high market share, we are well-positioned to play a dominant role in these markets.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Inficon Holding AG
texts.text: We expect, in line with the general economy development, a weakening business going into the last quarter of the  year. But on the one side, vacuum as a research and development as well as manufacturing technology is more  and more used for a widespread of applications in all kinds of industries. It is still the only technology that provides  the cleanest possible environment that is required for many high-tech applications. It has become more affordable  and less sophisticated and will continue to contribute to the growth in this market, especially in the [ph] Greek  (00:10:36) states where we experience a investment catch-up in vacuum-based technologies.

file: IFCN - Q3 2012 Earnings Call 18October2012 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 18-Oct-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Please turn to the next slide, number 6, where you'll see the breakdown of our sales into the four key markets that  we serve. Here, you can see the impact of the unexpected sharp drop of the semiconductor investments in the  Specific Vacuum Industries market which went down from 35% a year ago to now 29% only. Considering the  most stable optics and OLED market environment as well as the low solar market contribution a year ago already,  the pure semiconductor drop is even more severe, it fell down to below 50% of this segment of the pie chart. On  the positive side, contribution from our General Vacuum Processes, the Emergency Response & Safety (sic)  [Emergency Response & Security] (00:03:44) markets, colors dark blue and yellow, increased slightly.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Our broader product portfolio with the acquired Micro GC technology from Agilent as well as the handheld product  from [ph] Poltava (00:04:49) helps us to get access to customers that we have not served before, especially in the  energy transportation and petrochemical markets, we see a number of new applications with promising sales  potential. Even interest from the environmental market, especially in China renewed. We have an ongoing full  pipeline of interesting projects for water and air monitoring systems. Currently, we are in the final development  stage to come up with a new unique Micro GC product which will present it to the market by next spring. This new  product family will combine a new set of sensors as well as new software platforms that will allow customers to  easily find and verify dedicated specific gas molecules.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: U.S. Government reduced the strategic research for helium, and currently one of the helium production sites is  out of production due to scheduled plant maintenance, and therefore the price for helium went up. So, now we  can also offer solutions using hydrogen or very low helium concentration mixture as a trace of gas. Our state-of- the-art and patented product enable customers to cope with the type of specifications and change regulations for  more environmental friendliness and lower power consumption.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Consumers around the world continued to buy the latest and greatest gadgets, and together with innovations in  technologies, processes and software will drive the long-term growth in this market despite the current lower  semiconductor CapEx spending, improved energy efficiencies and better displays drove and will drive  investments in OLED, LED, optics and other film vacuum coating technologies. We continue to invest in new  products to our recently launched product for gas analysis and pressure measurement. We have had some  designing wins already for current product and processes as well as for future new generations of equipment and  manufacturing processes.

texts.speaker: Matthias Tröndle
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Vice President, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Specific Vacuum Process Industries, which includes solar display, optics and semi, had sales in the third quarter  of $20.2 million compared with $27.4 million in the third quarter of 2011. This represents a decrease of 26.3%. As  already mentioned in our press release, we experienced a significant decline in the semi market while thin-film  and optics markets developed more stable, sequentially, compared to second quarter, third quarter sales  decreased by $7.6 million, or 27.3%.

file: IFCN - Q3 2013 Earnings Call 22October2013 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 22-Oct-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: With a new product addition that has been developed in record time, we're able to generate additional sales in the  US to withstand the helium shortage that could have had a negative impact on our traditional line of helium leak  detectors. With this new product, we can offer our customers a product that they do not even have to change their  processes. They're just [ph] replacing (00:05:09) with the new product and can use hydrogen instead of helium  and they do not need to change their processes to find leaks.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: For the automotive industrial leak testing market, we offer now a complete line of helium and hydrogen leak  detectors. With close cooperation of customers, our dedicated application engineers are able to propose and  design the best solution to cope with changed regulations and the type of specifications. We continue to explore  attractive new markets for INFICON technology in a variety of new applications. Our first breakthrough milestone  has been reached in the food packaging market with three better side customers who committed to allocate time,  money and resources to test the new technology in close cooperation with the INFICON. A second new product  will be introduced early 2014 in the public utility market. This product will use new technologies and features to  find leaks in the natural gas distribution networks.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: In Specific Vacuum Process Industries markets, which I think include solar, display, optics and semiconductor  manufacturers on slide number eight, INFICON sales increased year-over-year by 9%, but decreased  sequentially by 12%. The unexpected decrease has been caused primarily, but we think temporarily slowdown in  the OLED market, where investments for the production of large size displays have been delayed, primarily to  overcome technical issues. The pure semiconductor business was stable, although, an expected high-tech  investment by a large ship manufacture has been pushed out into 2014. Not surprisingly, the photovoltaic solar,  as well as LCD flat panel display market remained very low. Manufacturing capacity that has been built up in this  market over the last couple of years is still higher than the market demand.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: On the other hand side, the transition to the 450 millimeter wafer sizes has been delayed. And, therefore,  investments into 300 millimeter technologies continue. Together with new investments for flat panel displays or  LEDs as well as the traditional LCDs and eventually some light improvements on the solar market makes this  high-end market still a very attractive market to be in. INFICOM, with its new line of gas analysis and pre-size  pressure measurement instruments, is well positioned to grow above market growth.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President and Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Finally, we had a disappointing third quarter 2013 in the General Vacuum Processes market, on slide number 9,  with a year-over-year decrease of 12% and driven sequentially by 3% which can be contributed primarily to sales  to our European distribution partners. Our products are highly respected around the world. They are well known to  be most technology advanced. Wherever vacuum is used as a necessity to have the cleanest environment, our  instruments are used to control, monitor and to cure the highest vacuum standards. We expect, in line with the  general economy development, the stable business going into the last quarter of the year, and we might even see  first improvements in the European market.

file: IFCN - Q3 2014 Earnings Call 22October2014 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 22-Oct-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Please turn to the next slide where you see the breakdown of our sales into the four focus markets that we serve.  The pie chart shows a higher contribution from the Refrigeration & Air Conditioning as well as the Specific  Vacuum Processes Industries market at primarily expense of the General Vacuum Processes market, but the  changes are relatively small.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Our new Fusion Micro GC is ready to gain market share in the industrial and analytical market. Additionally, we  see further businesses for our gas analysis core competence in the field of the energy production and distribution,  especially in the US where oil and gas hydrofracking technology became very prominent. Increased security  needs around the world, different industries, and unfortunately, even in war regions generate new business  opportunities for INFICON continuously.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Moving to Refrigeration & Air Conditioning, or the RAC market as we call it, on slide number 8. Sales increased  more than 10% year-over-year, and 3% sequentially, and ended the third quarter with $13.8 million, which is the  highest quarterly sales level ever. We continued to be the preferred number one supplier in the pure RAC market.  And again we gained market share in the automotive leak detection and adjacent industrial markets. With our full  line of helium/hydrogen refrigerant and multi-gas leak detection instruments, sensors and modules, we can fulfill  almost all customer needs for their quality inspection and leak-tightness applications.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Our products are used at all levels of the manufacturing process from components to subassembly testing, final  inspection as well as service and repair activities. We develop, manufacture, and sell the most complete range of  leak detection devices starting with an inexpensive, relatively simple battery-powered handheld instrument up to a  high and very sensitive multi-gas detection unit. Together with our experienced sales and support team, as well  as a worldwide service infrastructure, we are best positioned to help customers solving their leak problems, and  support them to reach their internal quality goals.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: As already announced three months ago, we finally entered the public utility market with the market launch of the  IRwin, which is a brand new, portable gas leak detection unit that allow users to find, qualify and quantify potential  dangerous gas leaks much faster and more accurate. The IRwin combines several well-known INFICON sensor  technologies into an integrated small instrument with unique specifications for an application in a – for INFICON  new marketplace. In January, we will start selling this new product in selected markets in Europe first, before we  expand our market reach into the US and Asia.

texts.speaker: Lukas Winkler
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG
texts.text: Therefore, we narrowed our full year guidance and expect now sales to be between $295 million and $305 million  for the full year 2014 and an operating income of between $46 million and $50 million. In order to keep up with the  increased demand for our gas analysis product lines, we just had the groundbreaking ceremony for a new  production facility in Syracuse Upstate New York in the US. In about one and a half years, we are going to fully  utilize the new manufacturing capabilities with improved processes, reduced lead times, state-of-the-art clean  room and calibration technologies. This investment of close to $20 million will enable us to cope with the  increased quality and volume demands around the world for the next 10 to 20 years.

texts.text: Together with our experienced sales and support team, as well as the worldwide sales and service infrastructure,  we are best positioned to help our customers finding – solving their leak problems and support them to reach their  quality goals.

texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG

texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG

These more  industrial-type leak detection applications were one of the drivers for the increased sales in Asia, especially in  China, where we enjoy a very high brand recognition supported by a loyal, well-established long-term market  organization.

texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG

texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, INFICON Holding AG

And the Security & Energy market had  a clearly better Q3 than last year, and increased by roughly 51%.

texts.text: Regionally, we experienced weakening demand in our Industrial Drives business, especially in China, and some  negative impact from the Thailand flooding was also seen in our Power business for computing and consumer  by contrast, remained very resilient and stable. texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The first samples are targeting electrical motors, solar inverters and factory automation applications. So we are  very much in line with the overall strategic focus of the Power businesses as well as of the sensor business. So that  makes us really target the systems with complete kits of semis.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: For your reference, the new division, Industrial Power Control, which focuses on electrical drives and renewable  energies, recorded sales of €196 million, with a segment result of €39 million. Whereas the new segment Power  Management & Multimarket – that's the kind of sister of that formerly IMM unit, which addresses the power  supply in RF applications – that segment stood at €222 million of revenues, with €40 million of segment result.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Coming back to the IMM results. With Power products' weaker demand during the quarter spread also into our  industrial motor drives, which we believe is a late-cycle part of our portfolio. Demand from laptops and desktops  showed typical negative seasonality, I think not a surprise to you, in our December quarter, amplified by the  effects of the floodings in Thailand.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Even though demand for our products from solar applications is currently subdued, good news reached us also  from this market. According to the latest new news from IMS Research, the worldwide photovoltaic market in  2011 might have seen new installations of about 26 gigawatt, recording a 50% year-over-year growth. A very  strong fourth calendar quarter, especially the month of December, with roughly 3 gigawatts of newly-installed  solar panels in Germany alone, contributed to this development. Although without an immediate effect on our  sales, we expect that this development accelerated the inventory burn-off on the part of our customers at the end  of last year.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Now let me come to the highlights of the quarter. We recorded a design win with our IGBT module at major OEMs  in the field of commercial, agricultural and construction vehicles, the CAVs. Developed with and for our  customers, these modules, these are the high-power modules, actually, from [indiscernible] (11:23) and will be  used in for diesel-electric power train applications, but are also meant to improve the safety of these big vehicles,  especially in situations when they have very little space to maneuver.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: And now, Industrial business, the typically late-cycle Drives business as well as Traction and Renewable Energy  are still on the weaker side. By contrast, the Computing and Consumer business appear to be stabilizing, but are  currently in a seasonally-weaker period of the year, which is very consistent with many of our peers who are in the  Consumer and Computing business.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: As for the new divisions, Power Management & Multimarket should exhibit typical negative seasonality for the  past Christmas quarter, and also Industrial Power Control should experience a further sales decline due to the  late-cycle nature of this business.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: To number one, how we will deliver superior growth and profitability is the question. Infineon's portfolio today is  focused on secular growth drivers, such as renewable energies, electromobility, and increased power conversion  efficiency in any device consuming electricity. Our components are key enablers for any solution addressing these  trends and we operate from a position of market share leadership and with competitive strength. This is evident in  our results in many ways. For the calendar 2011, our sales grew 14%, while semiconductor industry revenue was  flat and semi industry revenue, excluding microprocessors and memory, which we regard, by the way, as a better  benchmark, was up only 3%. So, 14% growth against 3% growth.

file: IFX - Q1 2013 Earnings Call 31January2013 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Jan-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Member-Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let's now move on to Industrial Power Control. IPC revenues amounted to €138 million, down from €181 million  in the prior quarter as volumes declined across all application segments.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Member-Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Sales in drives were weak as customers and distributors worldwide adjusted stock levels to lower demand. Sales  into renewable energy application also showed weakness as anticipated lower subsidies for wind in the U.S. and  solar in Germany crimped demand for our power modules and IGBT chips.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Member-Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: As for IPC highlights, November saw the launch of our new TRENCHSTOP 5 IGBT technology. Featuring a special  cell design and ultra-thin wafer technology, TRENCHSTOP 5 simultaneously achieves significantly lower  conduction and lower switching losses compared to currently leading solutions.  These benefits can be leveraged by our customer to either improve reliability over lifetime or increase the power  density of the designs' key differentiations and applications such as photovoltaic inverters, uninterrupted power  supplies and invertised welding machines. TRENCHSTOP 5 is now ramping into volume production.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Member-Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: An important highlight from PMM in the first quarter were the design win for our RF devices in the 3G and LTE  front-end in a major smartphone platform at a leading OEM customer. In addition rising power density  requirements for smartphone and tablet charges also lead to a design win for our CoolMOS devices at the same  customer.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Member-Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: When taking all RF power protection and MEMS devices into account, we estimate that Infineon can generate up  to dollars of content per smartphone or tablet. In server we have achieved our first design wins for the next  generation Intel mainstream server platform utilizing a complete Infineon power management solution, including  our digital controller, driver IC and power MOSFETs. This represents a continuation of the business success that  we are presently enjoying in the Romley platform.

file: IFX - Q1 2014 Earnings Call 30January2014 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 30-Jan-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Member-Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Additionally, Infineon was also recently awarded a design win for our RASIC water sensor platform with a major  Japanese customer. RASIC is a key component for safety applications such as autonomous emergency braking,  which will be required to achieve a Euro NCAP five-star safety rating beginning in 2015.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Member-Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Moving on to Industrial Power Control, IPC revenues in the December quarter totaled €17 9 million, down from  €197  million in the September quarter, with industrial drives experiencing worse than normal seasonality and   solar experienced normal seasonality. However, business in white goods, wind and traction experienced better  than normal seasonality.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Member-Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Thanks, Dominik. Let me now discuss our outlook for the fiscal second quarter and the remainder of the 2014  fiscal year. Infineon anticipates that second quarter revenues will increase by a mid-single digit percentage over  the first quarter. The sequential increase will be mainly driven by Automotive and CCS.

file: IFX - Q1 2015 Earnings Call 29January2015 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 29-Jan-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: For the mentioned LED driver products, Infineon launches the brand name LITIX, comprising the automotive  LED Driver Family for a reliable control of automotive exterior LED lighting applications. On the one hand, we  won a broad range of magnetic sensors used in electric power steering systems at major Tier 1. On the other hand,  we recorded another design win for our AURIX 65 -nanometer microcontroller for automotive emergency braking  and other ADAS application at the same Tier 1. The total expected lifetime revenue value of this bundle of wins  alone amounts to about €300 million.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: Another area of softness was in Traction after record sales in the last quarter of 2014 fiscal year. By contrast, we  experienced some relative strength from Wind Energy in China with an essentially flat development relative to the  previous quarter. Ahead of an announced reduction in feed-in tariffs in China after June 2015, we saw short-term  delivery requests for modules and stacks that we were able to satisfy. The book-to-bill ratio for the quarter  improved to about 1, up from the about 0.8 in the previous quarter. As a result of the €29 million decline in  turnover, segment result declined quarter-on-quarter by €16 million to €28 million. Despite the sales decline,  segment result margin remained at an attractive level of 15%.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: In terms of highlights, we continue to see strong demand for our 6.5 kV high power modules for traction  application in China with a strong contribution to order intake during the quarter. In addition, we saw good  design win momentum across our portfolio of products for industrial drives. In terms of new product  introductions, we are pleased to report that after the creation of a joint development lab with a Chinese customer,  we maintain our strong position for induction cooking with that customer. And now, saw first orders also for  power modules for air-con applications.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: Moving on to Power Management & Multimarket. PMM revenues for the first fiscal quarter were down, less than  what normal seasonality would suggest, to €280 million from €300 million in the preceding quarter. Within that,  seasonality was more pronounced for high-voltage MOSFET, silicon microphones, and DC/DC ACs. Areas of  relative strength by contrast were low- and medium-voltage MOSFETs, RF power amplifiers for base station, and  RF products for mobile phones.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: As regards our power products, we are pleased to report progress as well. In digital power management, we are  beginning deliveries of systems solutions for the voltage regulator generation, VR12.5 of server power  management. In AC/DC conversion, we have begun deliveries of our digital.dp solution for power supplies to a  major global laptop manufacturer and have been awarded a design win for a TV power supply by a major global  TV OEM.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: In addition to payment, we had several new design wins for government ID applications in Europe and North  America. We continue to see strong demand, embedded Secure Element driven by NFC application in mobile  devices, and we have won further designs at leading mobile device manufacturers. Finally, after an initial design  win with the SIM card for an automotive eco-solution in the fourth quarter of 2014 fiscal year, we are pleased to  report that the last quarter brought about another eco-design win at another major car maker.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Member of the Management Board, Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: Operating income was €153 million for the fiscal first quarter, up significantly from €118 million in the prior  quarter. Recall that operating income in the fourth quarter of the 2015 financial year included a non-recurring  charge of €83 million, in connection with the antitrust ruling of the European Commission against our CCS  division.

file: IFX - Q1 2016 Earnings Call 2February2016 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 02-Feb-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: A strong driver of the solid revenues in December quarter was electric mobility. After many years of investment,  we are very happy to see that electric drive trains for hybrid or battery-driven vehicles are reaching meaningful  numbers in the Chinese market.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: The Chinese Association of Auto Manufacturers expects that in 2016, the number of so -called new energy vehicles  sold in China could more than double compared to 2015 to about 700,000 units. The major ity of these vehicles  are passenger cars where local Chinese plants play a dominant role. We benefit in many ways from this trend.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Firstly, we are very strong in modules for passenger vehicles with Chinese customers. Secondly, we have also  made modules for the commercial sector, mainly electric buses in China from APC also featured in our last  quarterly presentation. During the quarter, we could further strengthen our leading position in applications  contributing to CO2 reduction.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Let us now take a look at Industrial Power Control. IPC generated revenues of €249 million compared to €271  million in the previous quarter. The quarter was affected by typical seasonality, and product segment drives  traction and renewables. In major home appliance, we experienced temporary weakness due to still very high  inventories at OEMs. However, we are convinced that we have won further market share in Decemb er quarter as  the Japanese market where we have limited exposure was very big. The book-to-bill ratio came in at 1.1 in the  December quarter pointing towards a typical seasonal upswing for the March quarter.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: The Segment Result declined to €23 million compared to €39 million in the September quarter. This translates  into a Segment Result Margin of 9.2%. On top of the normal operating leverage with lower revenue came a less  favorable product mix and ramp-up cost for this 200-millimeter Kulim 2 facility. A great highlight was the Paris  climate agreement. This, of course, substantiates our excellent prospect for renewable energies further.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: As an immediate consequence, the subsidies for voltaic installations in the U.S. were prolonged for five years to  2022. Besides, key customer using our PrimePACK modules for photovoltaic inverters, we see large orders for  utilities scale plants in the U.S. Given our leading position in both solar and wind energy inverters, we remain very  bullish for this sector.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Besides this, we continue to believe that growth ultimately creates the highest value for our shareholders. This  often requires patience when investing into long-term trends. Electric drivetrain for low-emission vehicles is an  excellent example. It has taken many years of investment, but now we see volumes becoming meaningful, driven  by China, poised to become the largest market for electric or hybrid vehicles in the world.

file: IFX - Q1 2017 Earnings Call 2February2017 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 02-Feb-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The book-to-bill ratio came in at 1.4. As in previous quarters, this figure contains a significant year of long-term  orders. But even without considering these, the book-to-bill ratio stood at around 1.2. The segment result  increased to €114 million from €112 million in the preceding quarter. This translate into a segment result margin of  16.2% in the December quarter. The strong momentum that we saw in electromobility in the last fiscal year  continued into the December quarter. China came in with about 507,000 so-called new energy vehicles sold in  2016 according to the Chinese Association of Auto Manufacturers.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Beside the strong traction in the two main mega trends, we also see very nice momentum in classic body  applications. Examples are power solutions from our LITIX family for LED front and rear lighting as well as more  and more business with relay replacement applications. This contributes to remarkably high bond shares on  specific OEM platforms.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let us now take a look at Industrial Power Control. IPC generated revenues of €264 million compared to €279  million in the September quarter. This marks a 5% decline quarter-on-quarter, very much in line with the normal  seasonality.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Like in previous quarters, the demand for inverter solutions for commercial vehicles in China continued with  strong momentum. It is currently driven by demand for electric buses, but other commercial vehicles such as  delivery vehicles are likely to drive future demand.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let us now come to Power Management & Multimarkets. Revenues of PMM decreased by 7% to €497 million,  down by €36 million from €533 million in the September quarter. A strong power business compensated partially  the seasonal weakness in the smartphone component business.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Looking at the power business in more detail. In AC-DC, revenues were seasonally down, but in DC-DC,  revenues were up against normal seasonal trends. In AC-DC, demands for 650-watt CoolMOS power MOSFETs  for electric vehicle charging stations remained on a high level. We are also very pleased by the ever-increasing  momentum of our 300 millimeter-based CoolMOS products where we see a design in pipeline in the excess of  €100 million. In DC-DC, we saw very nice momentum in server business, stemming from demand for the VR12  and the VR12.5 platforms. Other entry and design win momentum for the upcoming VR13 platform remained  high.

file: IFX - Q1 2018 Earnings Call 31January2018 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Jan-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer and Member of the Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The Segment Result Margins stood at 13.4%. The primary reason for this unexpected development is a  production related one-off charge. On the top of the very steep ramp that we're currently managing for electric  drivetrain-related modules, weighs on the margin before the output will kick-in in the second half of the fiscal year.  For this, we expect a gradually snapback of the ATV Segment Result Margin in the next three quarters to the  levels seen throughout the last fiscal year.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer and Member of the Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: We also realize that innovative xEV drivetrain topologies are hitting the market and require even more power  semiconductor. As illustrated in our quarterly presentation, the new NIO ES8 SUV requires four HybridPACK  Drive IBG (sic) [IGBT] modules. There is one motor at the front axle and one motor at the rear axle with two  modules per motor. This results in about €800 power semiconductors for the drivetrain, the highest value ever.  Second, the electric drivetrain business continues to ramp extremely strongly. Third, the Automotive business  remains very solid across the board.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer and Member of the Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Industrial Power Control, we posted revenues of €296 million compared to €328 million in the September quarter.  Year-over-year, this marks a 12% increase. Quarter-over-quarter, this means a seasonal decline of 10%. At a  constant U.S. dollar exchange rate, we would even have grown 15% year-over-year. Against seasonal trend,  demand for solar inverter solutions continued to be high. All other primary application areas showed a typical  seasonal decline. Order entry remained very strong and the book-to-bill ratio came in at 1.4. The Segment Result  came in at €48 million, down from €60 million in the September quarter; however, doubling year-over-year. The  Segment Result Margin came in at 16.2%.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer and Member of the Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The smartphone component business showed a typical seasonal decline. The RF power amplifier business for  base stations is stable. In AC-DC, we saw solid demand across all applications with an increasing order backlog,  especially demand for server power supply remains strong. Also, served from a small base, our power IC in AC- DC business is developing nicely, with a year-over-year growth of almost 40%. Adding further to this momentum,  we are ramping our XDP digital controller now also into lighting applications, and we are beginning to ramp our  new line of analog/mixed signal CoolSET products, integrated power and driver IC products.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer and Member of the Management Board, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Due to the booming demand for power discretes, we decided to significantly accelerate the ramp in Dresden 300  and are ramping as fast as we can to add new capacity. This pull-in, of course, triggers incremental costs in the  near term for the benefit of fast growth and higher profits in the coming years. However, adding the same capacity  on 200-millimeter would have cost even higher ramp-up costs than CapEx. As such, our 300-millimeter project not  only provides us a great runway to drive growth and fulfill the strong demand of our customer, but is also accretive  for Infineon's margins and earnings.

file: IFX - Q1 2019 Earnings Call 5February2019 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 05-Feb-19.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Recently, the European Union resolved on CO2 emission targets for 2025 and 2030. These are 15% and 37.5%  respectively, below the 95 grams to be achieved by 2021, calling for car OEMs to significantly increase their  efforts to electrify their fleets. Advanced driver assistance systems are the other main area of growth and provide  attractive opportunities for our system solutions, including radar sensors and our AURIX automotive  microcontroller. Taking the areas of EV and ADAS together, we continue to expect a year-on-year growth of 50- plus percent.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Industrial Power Control recorded quarterly revenue of €352 million, 2% lower than in the previous quarter, but up  by a staggering 19% year-on-year. Whereas industrial drives and home appliances saw typical seasonal declines,  renewable energy and traction proved quite resilient. Solar even showed a strong increase, which is remarkable  for the seasonally weaker December quarter and can be explained by China feed-in tariffs expected to be hiked  again in the new year. The book-to-bill ratio stood at 1.1, representing a mixed picture of products suffering from a  broad deceleration in the market and elevated inventories in the distribution channel such as gate drivers on the  one hand and high-power modules still in allocation on the other.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Wind and solar power as well as traction, however, still exhibit good growth momentum with continued strong  order intake for our high-power modules. With our differentiated product portfolio, we are addressing critical  customer needs. From a regional perspective, we continue making inroads into the Japanese market. In the past  quarter, we achieved two important design wins with our intelligent power modules there, in line with our aim to  offer complete system solutions.

file: IFX - Q2 2010 Earnings Call 28April2010 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 28-Apr-10.pdf
IFX - Q2 2011 Earnings Call 3May2011 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-May-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: We experienced normal negative seasonality in some consumer-related businesses, such as, for  example our game console products. That said, negative seasonality was more than offset by  growth in our RF and renewable energy businesses. Segment results grew slightly from €107  million in the fiscal first quarter, to €108 million in the fiscal second quarter.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Bookings during the quarter were strong, with a book-to-bill ratio of 1.25. Within that, the book-to- bill ratio for our power businesses was even higher than that of our non-power businesses. After       corrected transcript

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: In the aftermath of the Japan disaster, we find that customers are showing growing interest in our  so-called Capacity Insurance Program, the CIP. We started this program about a year ago. Under  the program, we enter into a strategic partnership with major customers, enabling optimized and  end-customer solutions with focus on energy efficiency. In this context, customers can reserve  certain amounts of capacity against advanced payments or firm take-or-pay obligations.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: As for product highlights, we have signed agreements with a customer in the smart metering arena,  in Europe and Asia-Pacific, under which we’ll provide a secure ASIC for the measurement of the  gas and electricity flow.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Further, we continue to make solid progress in the solar business. Having talked about traction of  the Chinese wind energy business last quarter, I’m now pleased to confirm today that momentum in  the solar inverters are equally strong. We have ramped shipments for our major European inverter  project and have secured major new design wins at two important solar inverter customers during  the last quarter.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Going forward, we’re excited about the growth potential that results from the need to conserve  electricity. Furthermore, recent events in Japan will likely lead to an even more aggressive  deployment of renewable energy generation, which should be beneficial to us. Finally, we stand to  profit from the advent of electro-mobility. In other words, in particular, energy efficiency and mobility  will be strong revenue drivers going forward.

file: IFX - Q2 2012 Earnings Call 3May2012 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-May-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let me now turn to the highlights of the quarter in Automotive. We achieved a design win for our new automotive- qualified IGBT module, HybridPACK 1, targeting mild-hybrid electric vehicles. The module features our new low- breakdown voltage 400-volt IGBTs. The lowest breakdown voltage so far stood at 650 volt. This is a real  innovation. The reduction in breakdown voltage is beneficial as upcoming mild-hybrid cars are operating on  battery voltages of only 150 volt or less.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Given the lower breakdown voltage, we were able to use the next generation of our 40-micron thin wafers, 40- micron versus the 70-micron we had before, to this is the thinnest wafer on the market. And as a consequence of  this leading-edge 40-micron thin wafer technology, the HybridPACK 1 module will reach a new level of efficiency.  We just have less losses in the switching when you use it in electric motors like in power ranges from 10 kilowatts  to 15 kilowatts. And the ramp of the new module is scheduled for 2014.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let me now turn to Industrial Power Control. IPC revenues in the second quarter were €174 million, down 11%  from €196 million in the first quarter. Segment result was €27 million, down from €39 million in the first quarter,

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: We saw ongoing weakness in home appliances as well as in consumer drives and low-power industrial  applications with power ranges up to 20 kilowatt. Our renewable business were flat, which is probably a surprise  to you, with the December quarter. In contrast to low-power industrial applications, the mid and high-power  industrial markets targeting triple-digit kilowatt up to megawatt applications in mining, cement mills or city water  supplies, those were in good shape. Nevertheless, customers are still in the process of reducing their inventory.  With cautious order behavior and continuing cancellations, book-to-bill was only about 0.5 in the March quarter.  I think we just see there that there is a switch in ordering behavior as we had a huge backlog. They just now order  to demand. And still, the Industrial business, as I mentioned in the very beginning, is a late-cycle business. So  recovery probably comes a bit later, one to two quarters later.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let me now turn to a few highlights in the IPC segment. We have achieved design wins recently for EconoPACK  and PrimePACK IGBT modules from several Chinese central inverter manufacturers. With this, we're beginning to  see major momentum in the important Chinese solar market.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In Energy Transmission, we booked design wins for high-voltage transmission and power quality, so the grid  quality, for so-called in VSC projects in Europe and Asia, with high-voltage IGBT modules. VSCs, which stands for  Voltage-Sourced Converters, are used in offshore and onshore high-voltage DC transmission lines with voltages  up to 400 kilovolts.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Despite all investment in R&D, selling and manufacturing, we're firmly in line with our financial targets. And  drivers for our top-line, such as an increased power conversion efficiency, variable-speed drives or electro- mobility are still in place. Addressing all these application markets from a leading position, from strong  investments into competitive manufacturing, innovation and sales, we're in a prime position to capitalize on any  acceleration of growth going forward.

file: IFX - Q2 2013 Earnings Call 2May2013 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 02-May-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In the terms of application, the picture was mixed. In industrial drives, though sales to European customers have  stabilized and even slightly increased, demand for drives in China has not shown any indication of a rapid  recovery. In the renewables, wind and solar continued declining, in particular due to the challenging market  environment in Europe.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: We have two highlights related to IPC's activities in the expanding Chinese renewables market. First and  foremost, on April 3, we signed a strategic cooperation with Sungrow, ranked by IMS Research as the largest  China-based solar PV inverter manufacturer with the number one position in its home market. We believe this  partnership with Sungrow will strengthen our presence in the rapidly growing Chinese solar market as well as  enhance our application support for power system solutions.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Separately, as part of the rapid build-up of solar and wind power generation in China, we received sizeable orders  during the quarter for our PrimePACK IGBT modules. Shipments of these products will provide a revenue  contribution in the double-digit millions of euros in the fiscal third and fourth quarter.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In terms of revenues, we expect a decline at the upper end of the mid to high single-digit percentage range versus  fiscal year 2012. Therein we continue to expect Automotive, PMM and CCS to perform above the group average,  IPC to perform significantly below the average, and OOS to continue declining versus the prior year.

file: IFX - Q2 2014 Earnings Call 29April2014 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 29-Apr-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In addition, we are seeing robust demand for our MOSFETs for speed control in fans and in electric pumps. By  adopting speed to actual situation, power consumption can be optimized enabling a reduction of CO2 per  kilometer. Demand is also solid for body power products used in application such as power distribution, power  doors, and trunk lifts.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Moving onto Industrial Power Control. IPC revenues in the March quarter totaled €185 million, up slightly from  €179 million in the December quarter. Moderate growth in industrial drives and firm demand in traction was  counterbalanced by a seasonal decline in home appliances and lower sales to wind power.

file: IFX - Q2 2015 Earnings Call 5May2015 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 05-May-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: We are proud that Infineon's AURIX microcontroller makes this sensor fusion control unit 100% reliable as not all  key components are automotive grade and need a little help from our AURIX. This collaboration nicely  complements our highly reliable Automotive products in sensors, power and microcontrollers. We also  strengthened our leadership in Automotive power semiconductors. We are now the first company worldwide  manufacturing Automotive Power MOSFETs on 300 millimeter thin wafers. The 40-volt OptiMOS 5 MOSFETs  qualified on 300-millimeter thin wafers are optimized for CO2 reduction applications.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Let me now comment on Industrial Power Control. The March quarter saw €241 million in revenue, up €51  million from the previous quarter. This increase is driven mainly by the consolidation of International Rectifier's  industrial business, the favorable effect came from the appreciation of the U.S. dollar and a normal seasonal  pickup. Sales were supported by a healthy demand in major home appliances and the better-than-expected  seasonality in renewables, driven by China ahead of an announced reduction in feed-in-tariffs in June 2015.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: In combination with the other intelligent power module business we have, we will achieve a much better cost  position due to the economies of scale as part of the integration plan. This plan is supported by recent design wins  in the major home appliances market during the quarter. Infineon's module and the former International  Rectifier's IRAM intelligent power modules complement each other. Consequently, we won business with the  IRAM modules at major air conditioning customers and with Infineon modules with kitchen white goods  manufacturers.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Furthermore, we bought the remaining shares of Korea-based intelligent power module maker, LS Power  Semitech, now we were the sole owner of the company. I'm very pleased to report that after increasing our stake to  majority and consolidating the company since June 2014, the segment result margin we now generate on LSPS  revenues is accretive to the IPC segment result margin, demonstrating our potential to grow profitably in modules  for white goods.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: We are confident that we will repeat this success for International Rectifier's intelligent power module business.  In combination with our own IPM business, we can achieve better economies of scale. Another highlight is that  the design win momentum for traction and drive in the first quarter continued during the second quarter.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Member of the Management Board & Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: Let me add some words on depreciation and amortization. Depreciation and amortization was €199 million, up  from €141 million in the previous quarter. Within the increase of €58 million, €33 million are related to the  purchase price allocation. This number does not include a €35 million non-cash impact on COGS stemming from  the step-up of International Rectifier's inventories, which I have mentioned earlier.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: An important aspect is the integration of International Rectifier's manufacturing footprint. The key principle of  our manufacturing strategy has been that we only manufacture products ourselves, we can differentiate in terms  of cost or performance. Following this guiding principle, we have already taken decisions on the future  manufacturing footprint of the combined businesses. We will discontinue manufacturing operations at Techview  in Singapore by the end of calendar 2015. We also will phase out the front and wafer production in Newport,  Wales in 2017. Therefore, we have started looking for buyers for the Newport facilities.

file: IFX - Q2 2016 Earnings Call 3May2016 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-May-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: The segment result increased to €94 million from €81 millio n in the preceding quarter. This translate into a  segment result margin of 14% compared to 13.2% in December quarter. The increase is a result of higher sales.  The strong momentum that we saw in electric mobility in the December quarter continued. The Chinese  Association of Auto Manufacturers confirmed the expectation that in 2016, the number of so -called new energy  vehicles sold in China might more than double compared to 2015 to about 700,000 units.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Besides the strong demand from running platforms, we co uld also further strengthen our position in the xEV  market for future platforms during the quarter. We secured several design wins for power components in inverters  for next generation plug-in-hybrid and purely electric vehicles at leading OEMs.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Let us now take a look at Industrial Power Control. IPC generated revenues of €265 million compared to €249  million in the preceding quarter. This marks a 6% increase quarter-on-quarter. Key drivers for the seasonal  upswing were the renewables and major home appliances. Outside China, demand from major home appliances  was strong. Inside China, we still see inventories of Chinese OEMs.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: The seasonal development in renewables started a bit earlier this year than typical. This also translated into a  strong demand for our silicon carbide diodes and hybrid modules, which feature a combination of our benc hmark  silicon IGBTs and silicon carbide diodes. Overall, we continue to be pleased with the strength that we see in  renewables, particularly in China. We remain very confident for the long-term outlook.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Let us now come to Power Management & Multimarket. Revenues of PMM decreased by 3% to €496 million, €14  million down from €510 million in the December quarter. We had expected a slight regression as PMM had a very  strong first quarter that showed only half the normal seasonal decline if you remember. The bo om in electric  vehicles in China is also felt in PMM. We delivered our 650 -volt CoolMOS Power MOSFETs into charging stations.  China is currently setting up a network of those.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: The outstanding performance of our Superjunction Technology provides advantages on system level. This allows  for a very compact design of these charging stations and drove a strong demand for our CoolMOS product. This  momentum will continue.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Looking at the power business as a whole, the business was more or less flat when comparing the margin in the  December quarters, this AC-DC a bit better and DC-DC a bit softer. However, this is also as a result of the strong  December quarter they experienced a much better seasonality in the power business at the time.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Member of the Management Board & Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: So, by now, we have repaid all of the bank financing related to the International Rectifier acquisition. We  currently have a good couple of billion of debt capacity left within our target capital structure and are thus very  well-positioned to raise acquisition finance if and when the right opportunity arises.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: I also want to highlight that in spite of some general doubts in the market, on the growth momentum in China, we  see some key verticals that have not only solid long-term growth trajectories, but also, on the short and mid-term.  Among these are electric vehicles, charging stations, renewables, traction, mobile infrastructure, but also, Chinese  smartphones.

file: IFX - Q2 2017 Earnings Call 4May2017 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 04-May-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Turning to Industrial Power Control. IPC posted revenues of €293 million compared to €264 million in the  December quarter.
