This marks the steep 11% increase both quarter-on-quarter and year-on-year significantly  above normal seasonality. Components for low and medium power applications were in exceptionally high  demand across the board. Here, some home appliances, solar, metro, regional transport and drives for discrete  factory automation are the key applications. Demand for high-power applications such as large industrial drives or  high speed trains remain sluggish. The book-to-bill ratio came in at 1.3 in the March quarter. The segment results  stood at €44 million compared to €24 million in the December quarter. This means a segment result margin of  15%.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The key highlight for IPC is the progress of our silicon carbide program. We have always said that large-scale  adoption of silicon carbide MOSFETs will start with industrial application. These applications comprise  photovoltaic inverters, charging station for electric vehicles, uninterruptible power supplies and motion drives,  for  example. As we speak, this broad-based traction in industrial application is becoming a reality. We started  sampling our first trench silicon carbide MOSFET and full silicon carbide modules to select customers last fall.  Just from this first project, we see a revenue potential of a low-triple-digit million euro amount over the next years.  We are confident that a growing share of this potential will turn into future business. We are very much on track to  bring the best silicon carbide MOSFET design to the market. This is not only what we believe, but also what we  hear from our customers who have tested the samples.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Now, turning to Power Management & Multimarket, revenues of PMM increased by 5%, both year-on-year and  quarter-on-quarter, to €520 million. We saw a very strong power business across the board exhibiting year-on- year growth in the mid teens. Our smartphone and RF power-component business hit their seasonal lows with  some pockets even showing snap backs. In AC-DC, demand for high voltage CoolMOS, PowerMOS sets was  strong across all applications. In addition, we saw a good traction in digital power ICs with increased demand in  notebook charges and desktop power supply application. In DC-DC, we also saw a strong momentum across all  application and voltage classes. Demand for solutions in the VR12.5 server platform remained high.

file: IFX - Q2 2018 Earnings Call 3May2018 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-May-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: This improved profitability was caused by productivity gains and a favorable product mix, with gate drivers seeing  an all-time high. Macro-indicators remain solid and point to sustained market growth above long-term trend. We  see continuous momentum across applications, be it automation drives, renewable energies, traction or home  appliances.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The power business remains very strong across all applications and products evidenced by high order entry  leading to a book-to-bill ratio of 1.4. In both AC-DC and DC-DC, we saw unabated customer demand with both  areas continuing to be supply constrained. Our CoolMOS benefits from increasing pull coming from our  customers in electro-mobility for onboard chargers and charging infrastructure.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Third, we want to address customer demand for power discretes in the best possible way, and we'll continue the  accelerated ramp to add new capacities. Our objective is to invest decisively in order to fully capitalize on the  long-term opportunities presented by the structural growth drivers of our target markets.

file: IFX - Q2 2019 Earnings Call 7May2019 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 07-May-19.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The auto demand picture in China remains inconclusive given EV subsidies cuts on the one hand and stimulus  indications on the other. For global car production, most major market analysts are predicting a decline in  calendar year 2019. In our projection for the 2019 fiscal year, we have now embedded a low-to-mid single-digit  car unit decline affecting our business with traditional automotive applications such as engine management or  body and safety functions.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Industrial Power Control recorded revenues of €347 million, a decrease of 1% compared to the previous quarter,  whereas typical seasonality in the March quarter would be a sequential increase by a mid-single-digit percentage.  Industrial drives solar and home appliance sales experience declines, whereas traction and wind help up value.  Year-on-year revenue was up by 9% or 7% at our constant U.S. dollar exchange rate. The segment result for the  second fiscal quarter was €67 million, €2 million lower than the previous quarter, resulting in a segment result  margin of 19.3%.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: This GDP growth for 2019 now predicted by the IMF to be just under 3%. The IGBT market is at long-term trend  line. Wind and solar power as well as traction remain pockets with a positive outlook. Here, our differentiated  high-power modules address critical performance and quality requirements, like extreme ruggedness and  reliability needed for offshore wind farms.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: With our PrimePACK module based on the IGBT5 and .XT technology to secure an important design win at a  major clean wind turbine supplier. Also for more customer-oriented products be encouraged by design wins at our  customers like for a protected IGBT especially designed for induction rice cookers, at a Chinese home appliance  manufacturer or an intelligent power module, IPM in short, at a European household goods supplier.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Also, we are extending the voltage range for our silicon carbide MOSFET product portfolio. Some days ago, we  have announced the first 650 volt products. In addition, we are making good progress with our gallium nitride  devices where we achieved a design win at an Asian manufacturer for an ultra-compact and efficient power  supply for a super slim OLED TV. After telecom equipment, high-resolution premium OLED TVs are the second  market having reached the tipping point for gallium nitride products.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: We continue to see good momentum for differentiated high-power components for electric drivetrain and a  number of industrial applications like traction and renewables. Here we partly remain in allocation. Furthermore,  demand for our radar products and AURIX microcontrollers stay healthy. Taken together, we see that the June  and September quarters will be sub-seasonal, but Infineon will be one of the very few among its peers showing  year-on-year growth.

file: IFX - Q3 2010 Earnings Call 28July2010 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 28-Jul-10.pdf
IFX - Q3 2011 Earnings Call 28July2011 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 28-Jul-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Furthermore, in order to enable further growth, Infineon decided to begin building a shell for a second 200  millimeter cleanroom module at existing highly cost efficient frontend site, Kulim, Malaysia. This capacity  expansion steps are a part of our budgeted investment of €850 million for the 2011 fiscal year that we might  actually exceed slightly. We anticipate that investments might rise further in the 2012 fiscal year, but we'll provide  more concrete guidance on this when we report the next quarter in November 2011. And keep in mind the power  300 millimeter project is a significant part of that.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let me now turn to product highlights. In the area of hybrids and electric vehicles, we are pleased to report that  our HybridPACK 2 power module has passed all necessary qualifications and is now ready for volume production.  Several important Tier 1s already use this module in their inverted designs, and it has been proven in the field  within pilot series of electrical vehicles of several leading OEMs.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: With the power business, demand for motor drives was especially strong, which is by the way not unusual as the  machinery industry and the process automation industry is typically a little bit, well, lagging in economical cycles,  so they are dragging on quite strongly at the moment. In that respect, I would also like to point new energy  efficiency regulations that took effect in the U.S. and Canada in December 2010, and that demand enhanced  energy efficiency for electrical drives.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The regulations in the U.S., for example, explicitly recommend that federal buyers consider procuring variable  speed drives and replace certain classes of motors with variable speed drives instead of repairing them. Similar  rules will be effective by 2015 in Europe. Such regulation is supporting further the demand for variable speed  drives, having silicon content of up to €5 per kilowatt of motor power in power modules alone. In addition to  drives, further revenue increases were seen in lighting, renewable energy, consumer and computer applications,  the latter especially coming from demand in the server market.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: As for product highlights, I would like to start with the design win for our premium efficiency, medium-voltage  OptiMOS power switch and one of the global market leaders in solar microinverters. Solar microinverters are  especially suited for on-roof applications and are extremely popular in the U.S. market, as their superior safety  characteristics contribute to better insurance conditions. Unlike traditional central or string inverters, where one  inverter have several panels, microinverters can be disconnected in the event of a fire, meaning they are not  generating high voltages that could potentially endanger firefighters. This in turn leads to superior home  insurance conditions.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The silicon content of a microinverter is about €30,000 per megawatt of power generated, and is therefore quite a  bit higher than a €3,000 to €14,000 of silicon content in traditional inverters. Within the communications part of  our portfolio, we secured design wins with our major smartphone manufacturers for our GPS GLONASS RF-front- end modules.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Coming to newly introduced products, I would like to mention our 4.5 kilovolt IGBT module, which was presented  at the PCIM in Nuremberg. This device broadens our IGBT portfolio, closing the gap between the 3.3 kv and the  6.5 kv modules and is especially suited for traction and HVDC applications. It features lower switching losses,  reduced cooling requirements and ultimately lower system cost for our customers.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Ladies and gentlemen, this brings me to the end of my introductory remarks. To summarize, in the third quarter  of our fiscal year, we again grew faster than our market and our competition. Total segment result margin  remained at last quarter's high levels. This again proves that our strategic direction with a focus on energy  advantage by driving industry-leading 300-millimeter manufacturing of power discrete semiconductors out of our  newly-acquired facility in Dresden, Germany and by expanding capacity also at our highly cost efficient site in  Kulim, Malaysia. The management team and myself will continue to work hard on delivering steadily in quarters  to come.

file: IFX - Q3 2012 Earnings Call 31July2012 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Jul-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Despite all macro challenges, the latest product highlights from the Automotive division demonstrate that we,  Infineon, continue to lead in this market. First and foremost, we have been recognized by two of our key  customers for our excellence in quality and technological innovation. For the third year running, Conti,  Continental, has recognized us as the Supplier of the Year for discrete and standard components. And in addition,  Denso in Japan has awarded the Technical Development Award to us for our Tire Pressure Monitoring System. It  is the first time that Denso has ever recognized a non-Japanese supplier with this kind of award. It's also  noteworthy that with the last one-and-a-half years, we have now shipped over 1 million power modules dedicated  to electric power steering applications. So if the power modules are added together with microcontrollers, drivers,  sensors and other chips that Infineon also provides, we are taking – we're talking about between €12 and €20 of  silicon content per vehicle for this application.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: EPS is a critical technology involved in making cars more environmentally and user-friendly. Unlike hydraulic  power steering systems, EPS becomes active only when it's needed, thus reducing fuel consumption. Also, since  EPS doesn't require hydraulic fluid, it also reduces waste and it's easier to service.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let me also here turn to a few highlights from the quarter. In addition, sorry – in addition to constructing new  athletic venues for the upcoming Olympics, London has also been building up a fleet of environmentally friendly  hybrid electric buses that will shuttle athletes and visitors around the city. Powered by Infineon PrimePACK  modules, the new buses not only deliver fuel savings of about 30% but also reduce nitrogen oxide emissions by  20%.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In addition, a Japanese solar inverter company has developed a prototype 10-kilowatt inverter using Infineon's  silicon carbide JFETs in site. That's a true innovation. In concert with Infineon's direct driver ICs, the prototype  was able to achieve an impressive 99.2% efficiency, a considerable improvement over the 98% range for products  on the market today. This further illustrates Infineon's leadership position in utilizing silicon carbide to improve  inverter performance and reduce system cost and complexity.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: For PMM product and market highlights, well, let's start with our Power Management business. We saw growth  across multiple application and service. In MOSFETs – sorry – in MOSFETs, we won a significant design in the  as well as our OptiMOS low-voltage MOSFETs and driver ICs, as our server customers continue ramping to serve  the demand for cloud computing.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Outside of Power Management, our RF power transistor business continued to be affected by customer inventory  corrections, though we expect a return to growth in the fourth quarter. CMOS switches also experienced a brief  pause, as we shift customer projects from 350-nanometer-based product to 130-nanometer-based products.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: And let me conclude now by covering Chip Card & Security. CCS revenues increased by 9% to €122 million, up  from €112 million in the prior quarter. Segment result also improved significantly from €14 million to €18 million  due to a favorable product mix and a high utilization level.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Amongst our divisions, Power Management & Multimarket will experience a seasonal increase. Industrial Power  Control is expected to remain flat. Chip Card & Security will decrease slightly, and Automotive is expected to  experience its normal seasonal summer decline. Revenue in the Other Operating segment will decline as foundry  production of our former wire line and wireless communication businesses continue to phase out.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Despite the present macroeconomic climate, which is somewhat uncertain and makes the prognosis a bit more  difficult, Infineon's mid- and long-term growth prospects in our focus areas of energy efficiency, mobility and  security remain highly promising. Recent investments in research and development, sales and marketing and  production capacity ensure that we are well-positioned to react and to benefit from any upturn in the market  demand.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Strategically, we're on course, I would say, to sustain our leadership in our focus areas of energy efficiency,  mobility and security. All areas have a strong potential for sustainable and profitable growth despite economic  uncertainties. Operationally, our execution quality is at a very high level, having been able to consistently fulfill  customer demand through the allocation period as well as now carrying out investments in leading thin wafer and  tremendous investments in future profitable growth and further improved competitiveness and still kept a strong  balance sheet.

file: IFX - Q3 2013 Earnings Call 30July2013 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 30-Jul-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let's continue on to Industrial Power Control. IPC revenues in the June quarter totaled €17 3 million, up from  €144 million in the prior quarter. Sales increased in all market segments, most significantly in renewables for  China, where demand was strong for IGBT stacks for wind, and PrimePACK and EconoDUAL for modules for  solar power. These successes reflect our solid position with leading Chinese players in renewables such as  Goldwind and Sungrow. Traction and home appliances also picked up nicely.

file: IFX - Q3 2014 Earnings Call 30July2014 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 30-Jul-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Now, for the divisional revenue starting with Automotive. Automotive revenues came in at €510 million, up 5%  sequentially as car production in all regions continued to grow. Our German premium OEM end customers in  particularly recorded significant sales growth. Within ATV, demand for body power products and power  MOSFETs remained solid. These products are important contributors to reducing CO2 emissions, for example, by  enabling our customers to replace brushed DC motors is more efficient, brushless DC motors require more  semiconductors.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: For this quarter's Automotive highlight, we are proud to announce that Audi's new S1 performance vehicle utili zes  Infineon's Basic LED Driver Family to power its rear lighting. The innovative solution was developed as part of  our long-running partnership with Audi. Compared to conventional solutions, the Basic LED Driver Family not  only reduces component count and complexity in a system but also enables advanced diagnostic functionality.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Basic LED drivers are now shipping in volume and are expected to ramp in the coming quarters as automotive  OEMs like Audi increasingly use LEDs to differentiate their vehicle designs.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Now turning to Industrial Power Control. IPC generated revenues of €200 million in the June quarter, up €15  million versus the March quarter. Wind, solar and white goods recorded strong growth. Industrial drives grew  moderately while demand for traction remained at a high level.

file: IFX - Q3 2015 Earnings Call 30July2015 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 30-Jul-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: I would also like to point your attention to a small but important innovation of magnetic sensors that helps reduce  power consumption and, ultimately, CO2 emissions. We have developed a 3D magnetic Hall sensor measuring  three-dimensional linear or rotary movements. The standby current consumption is extremely low such that it can  run for [ph] many decades (06:18) with a small battery. This 3D magnetic sensor contributes to our leading  position in magnetic sensors that is used in automotive, but finds also application in other areas, where low  standby [indiscernible] (06:36) such as industrial or Internet of Things.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Now, let us turn to Industrial Power Control. IPC generated revenues of €269 million, up €28 million from the  previous quarter. This increase was mainly driven by the normal seasonal pickup. We saw a strong demand in  major home appliances, drives and the continued strength in renewables. With a new five-year plan in China in  preparation, we continue to expect a strong drive for the new installations in renewables, particularly in solar.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: We saw a healthy order intake during the quarter with the book-to-bill ratio improving to 1.1. The segment result  improved significantly to €32 million compared to €20 million in the previous quarter. The resulting segment  result margin improved by 4 percentage points to 11.9%. Here, I would like to mention that our segment major  home appliances continues to contribute nicely to revenue generation. Revenue wise, it has surpassed the traction  segment in this quarter. This supports our long-term growth strategy in this segment, which we highlighted last  quarter with the acquisition of the remaining shares of LSPS and the combination of with International Rectifier's  IRAM business. The market is driven by the [indiscernible] (08:08) inverterization of electric motors and  microwave ovens, improving the energy efficiency of these household goods.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: May I draw your attention to an example how quickly we are progressing with the integration of International  Rectifier. A joint team from International Rectifier and Infineon developed and produced customer samples for  the motherboard DC/DC power stage for next-generation server platforms. This high-performance power stage  solution integrates Infineon's leading low-voltage OptiMOS technology into an application tailored package from  International Rectifier.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: The power stage solution achieved further efficiency improvements and be combined either with Infineon or  International Rectifier controllers, exactly matching the respective customer requirements. This was implemented  in record time across continents and time zones. Examples like this one prove to us that we are indeed becoming,  again, stronger as a joint team and can serve customer wishes even better.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: I would also like to mention that we brought the next generation of our high-voltage CoolMOS Superjunction  technology called C7 into production of 300-millimeter. This CoolMOS technology offers highest efficiency in hard  switching application for server, telecom and other industrial application requiring high efficiency. With this  technology, we have now a further technology qualified on 300-millimeter and are confident to increase the  utilization of our 300-millimeter capacities step-by-step.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Member of the Management Board & Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: Now, coming to depreciation and amortization. Depreciation and amortization remained essentially flat at €205  million compared to €203 million in the previous quarter. Within this figure, €35 million are related to the  purchase price allocation. This number does not include the €38 million non-cash impact on COGS stemming  from the consumption of the fair value step-up of International Rectifier's inventories.

file: IFX - Q3 2016 Earnings Call 2August2016 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 02-Aug-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Arunjai Mittal
texts.profession: Member of the Management Board, Regions, Sales, Marketing, Strategy Development and M&A
texts.text: Yeah. Thank you, Reinhard. I am very proud to have been part of this fantastic company for so long and see it  prosper into the position it is today. This is to a great extent due to the focus we have had on the three segments,  Energy Efficiency, Mobility and Security were also due to the ability to balance out the turbulences one might  experience at one or the other micro segments, for example, the smartphones.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Let us now turn to Industrial Power Control. IPC generated record revenues of €280 million, compared to €265  million in the March quarter. This marks again a 6% increase quarter-on-quarter. The seasonal upswing was  mainly driven by renewables, whilst major home appliance and drives were essentially flat and traction showed a  sequential decline due to some project delays. The book-to-bill ratio stood at 1 in the June quarter, pointing  towards a flat to slightly up September quarter. The segment result improved strongly to €42 million, compared to  a €26 million in the March quarter. This represents a segment result margin of 15%.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: The increase in segment result comes from an advantageous product mix, higher sales and productivity  improvements. Our leading position in both solar and wind inverters proved essential for the performance of IPC.  A lot of the demand was driven from China on the back of an upcoming change and the Feed-in Tariffs scheme.  However, we see this demand from China to persist, as Chinese vendor will have increased bandwidth to hunt for  global sockets thereafter.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: We continue to see strong demand for our silicon carbide diodes and hybrid modules. Once the intended  acquisition of Wolfspeed closes, we expect a lot of traction in silicon carbide product from the renewables during  2017. Besides, we very pleased with the recovering demand for inverter solution for electric buses in China. We  expect very high year-on-year growth rate from this segment going forward.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Let us now make a look at Power Management & Multimarket. Revenues of PMM increased by 3% to €509  million, €13 million up from €496 million in the March quarter. The whole Power business experienced a strong  seasonal upswing across the board. In AC-DC, demand from China for our 650-volt power MOSFET for xEV  charging station remained very high.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: In 2014, our relative market share stood at 2.7%. On a five-years horizon, we are convinced to deliver our 8%  trend line growth. We will benefit from strong structural demand drivers, be it electromobility, ADAS, renewable,  power conversion, sensor and cellular handsets, or IoT security, to name a few examples.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: We also want to create the clear number one in silicon carbide for power application. We will accelerate the  adoption of silicon carbide by cutting edge products as the clear cost performance leader. Capitalizing on the  incremental growth potential in [ph] novel technologies (25:17) and architectures using compound  semiconductors, we are convinced that we can solidify our 8% growth target.

file: IFX - Q3 2017 Earnings Call 1August2017 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 01-Aug-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Second, the momentum in the electric drivetrain is accelerating. In the nine months of the current fiscal year, we  have achieved almost twice the amount of new design wins in Europe for our IGBT solution as during the entire  fiscal year 2016. Module represent the majority of these design wins. Typical, for Automotive revenue, they will  stretch into the next decade. This year – this trend shows that IGBT solution will remain the mainstream  technology for electric drivetrains in the years to come. It also shows that the migration to electric powertrain has  reached a tipping point.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: We have also seen a strong interest in our full silicon carbide automotive module prototypes. We have already  received significant sample orders. This gives us great confidence that we are in an excellent position to win  silicon carbide slots in main inverters that are due for the mass production early next decade. Infineon is in a  unique position, being able to offer the individually best fitting solution to the customer, be it IGBT or silicon  carbide.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In Industrial Power Control, we posted revenues of €321 million compared to €293 million in the March quarter.  This marks an all-time high and a steep 15% increase year-over-year and a 10% increase quarter-over-quarter,  significantly above normal seasonality. Components for all power classes were in high demand, although demand  for high power modules is still modest. While all major application areas showed growth, the highest growth came  from home appliances and solar. The book-to-bill ratio came in at 1.3 in the June quarter. The segment result  came in at €55 million compared to €44 million in the March quarter. The segment result margin stood at 17.1%.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Now, we can report that this potential is turning step-by-step into design wins. With SMA and KACO opting for our  silicon carbide MOSFET modules, leading solar inverter makers have chosen our solution for deploying full silicon  carbide MOSFET based inverters in the market.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Second, we realized the first design win for our full silicon carbide MOSFET modules in high-power charging  station with a premium electric vehicle OEM. This demonstrates the competitiveness of our device. This also  supports our view that after the solar inverter market, xEV charging infrastructure will be the next market that sees  large-scale deployment of silicon carbide.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let me add a view on the silicon carbide market in general. We note that there are plenty of views on this  perceived disruption. However, as always in our power market, things evolve gradually to the sticky nature and  the long product life cycles of the business. The silicon carbide share of the combined silicon IGBT and silicon  carbide market will be below 10% by 2020, assuming the ramp scenarios by market analysts.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In AC-DC, demand for high voltage CoolMOS Power MOSFETS continued to be very strong across all  applications. In addition, we saw a strong growth in our digital power IC business with increased demand in  notebook charger and desktop power supply applications.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: As in the March quarter, our broad-based distribution business with multi-sourced products drove incremental  growth. We also secured design wins for our power ICs in game console applications. Our smartphone  component business, especially our Low Noise Amplifier business developed well. We recorded the highest ever  unit shipments for this product class.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Continuous progress in our trench silicon carbide MOSFET program with revenue potential turning into design  wins at leading solar inverter makers and first design wins for xEV charging infrastructure applications.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Power management continues to be strong. Lead times are still very high. More and more design wins with our  digital power ICs in PMM. In CCS, the payment market stabilized, government ID and embedded SIM are drivers.

file: IFX - Q3 2018 Earnings Call 1August2018 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 01-Aug-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In the same fashion, we keep winning new business across a broad range of our automotive target areas. This  classic applications, we were awarded the next generation TPMS platform for major European tier-1, the start of  production in 2021 and a lifetime value in excess of €100 million. On the electric drivetrain side, a major North  America tier-1 selected an Infineon chipset for the xEV inverter platform for one of the world's largest OEMs. The  combination of an IGBT module with the driver and RX microcontroller and a power management IC is  highlighting the strength of our xEV system solution. The value of this design win is also more than €100 million.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let's come to Industrial Power Control, where we saw revenues of €349 million, an all-time high quarterly figure  compared to €317 million in the March quarter. Quarter-over-quarter, this translate into a growth of 10%. Year- over-year increase was 9%. The constant exchange rate IPC would have grown 11% year-over-year. While  almost all application fields contributed to this development drives, major home appliance, wind, and industrial  power supplies saw particularly strong growth.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: We see unabated momentum across applications with particular strength coming from an industrial automation  and home appliances. Also, renewable energy is holding up well. The cut in feed tariffs in China will certainly lead  to a short-term slowdown of photovoltaic installations there. However, some of that drop will be offset by demand  from other regions, and also wind, power and energy saving applications are showing encouraging signs. From a  regional perspective, we see significant business opportunities in Japan and are currently building a meaningful  project funnel with customers there.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The power business is benefiting from additional production capacity coming on line, yet remain supply  constrained. Somewhat related to this, strong order entry is leading to a book-to-bill ratio of 1.8.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Thank you, Dominik. For the last quarter of our fiscal year, we expect revenues to increase by 3% plus or minus 2  percentage points. This assumes a rate of $1.2 for the U.S. dollar against the euro for the remainder of the  quarter. The growth expected of ATV as well as for IPC is in line with group average. PMM should come in  meaningful above group average. The CCS revenues are expected to decline.

texts.speaker: Operator

In line with the typical positive seasonality before Christmas,  gaming and mobile applications drove strong demand for ASICs as well as for RF and protection  devices. Growth across all power classes of our industrial products was equally strong. This trend  was in line with strong demand for industrial machinery and renewable energy products.

file: IFX - Q4 2011 Earnings Call 16November2011 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 16-Nov-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: For the inverter, these models use our HybridPACK1 power modules, which are especially designed for a power  range of up to 30 kilowatts. Two power modules are typically used in full hybrid cars. Additionally, we are pleased  to announce a design win at a major European Tier 1, with our 130-nanometer E-Power solution for body  applications, showing continuous traction of our highly integrated BCD products.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Now, let's go over to Industrial & Multimarket. IMM fourth quarter revenues remained flat with last quarter's all- time high of €472 million. Within that, lower sales in the renewable energy and computing markets were  compensated by higher demand for industrial motor drives and non-power products. Segment result remained  essentially flat at €113 million versus €116 million in the third quarter.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The German Association of Industrial Machinery Suppliers, the VDMA confirmed its forecast of 14% year-over- year, growth in industrial machinery bookings in 2011, announced that it expects further growth of about 4% for  the year 2012. For renewables, the decline was predominantly caused by the slowdown of the China Wind market,  as grid connection, bottlenecks and technical standard issues are there, which need to be tackled.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The overall agreement spans the coming five years. I'm pleased to say that three top OEMs in this field chose our  IGBT modules for their latest designs. Furthermore, our IGBT modules are experiencing growing traction in  Japan. Amongst others, we had a design win with a Japanese car manufacturer for products for EV charger  stations.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Relative to our announcement at October 14, now also our customers in the typically late cycle Industrial  businesses, you remember we do have some consumer computing communication business through our power  supplies, which typically acts pretty much in line with the rest of the industry. But we do also have a significant  portfolio in the industrial – heavy industrial customers, which are typically late-cycle reaction customers.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: So, also, that now has been affected by the economic uncertainty, whereby, I'd say it's more a reaction again to the  overall market sentiment than there's real lack of demand. As such, in addition to the factors we already talked  about in our pre-announcement, we have observed demand reductions also in our Industrial business now,  especially also from China. Here, we did have inventory corrections on the Industrial Power business related to  renewables and related to electric motors. In addition, payment applications in our Chip Card business have  continued to weaken. And we're seeing some impact to our Government ID business from the unfortunate  Thailand floodings as assembly partners of ours find their facilities there underwater.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Within that, we plan to spend about €150 million on long-term strategically important fab projects, which we have  already in the previous calls elaborated on, that have no immediate revenue contribution in 2012. The preparation  of volume production of power discretes on 300-millimeter wafers and our site in Dresden and the construction –  that's in Germany – and the construction of a second building at our Kulim site in Malaysia.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: We believe that it is important to stay firm on our 300-millimeter effort for power discretes given our strong  competitive advantage and time-to-market lead in this field. Equally, the expansion of our Kulim facility will add  needed and highly cost-efficient capacity in the mid-term. Other strategically important projects are the expansion  of our high-power module – high-power module capacity, as well as investments in quality innovation and fab  automation for a total of about €250 million.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Secular trends, such as the advent of the hybrid and electric drive-train, electricity generation from renewables,  increased efforts to reduce electricity, well, and fast growth in the part of the world's population that can afford  goods containing our products, will continue to drive the demand for our products.

texts.speaker: Peter Bauer
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: And in addition, we'll divide the IMM division into two parts, Industrial Power Control and Power Management &  such electrical drives and generators, whilst Power Management & Multimarket will focus on low and medium  power ratings in applications, such as power supplies for servers, laptops and televisions. With both changes, we  will increase further our focus on making the most of our opportunities.

file: IFX - Q4 2012 Earnings Call 14November2012 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 14-Nov-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: EVP, Director-Operations, Research & Development, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let's now move on to Industrial Power Control. IPC revenues amounted to €181 million, up from €177 million in  the prior quarter. Segment result came to €26 million, the same level as the prior quarter. Book-to-bill was 0.5, as  order intake from both our direct customers and our distributors remained weak.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: EVP, Director-Operations, Research & Development, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Now, for some highlights from IPC in the September quarter. We are seeing strong interest in the market for our  latest 4.5-kilowatt power modules. These modules extend our product portfolio for applications including wind,  traction and high-voltage DC transmission. Additionally, sales of our new EconoDUAL 3 IGBT modules are  beginning to gain momentum at our Chinese and European customers. Utilizing advanced copper wire bonding,  these modules offer the highest powered entity available on the market for the given footprint, an important factor  in applications such as wind and medium voltage drives.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: EVP, Director-Operations, Research & Development, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Product highlights from PMM in the fourth quarter. Let us start with our .dp family or digital power management  ICs for AC-to-DC conversion applications; .dp products include innovative technologies from Infineon, such as a  cordless transformer for safe and reliable electrical isolation and digital programmability for maximum flexibility.  This family of product has begun shipping in volume for power adaptors. Customers involved in LED lighting are  also ramping their design-in activities for .dp. In addition, we are proud to announce that customers are now  beginning to design in our newly released CoolMOS CE product, which are an extensive of our successful  CoolMOS family. Ideally, CoolMOS CE can be paired with our .dp controllers to deliver our customers high  efficiency power conversion system while reducing their system costs.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: EVP, Director-Operations, Research & Development, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Just as the combination of our Primarion digital power management technology and our power discrete helped us  build a sizeable presence in DC/DC conversion for service, the combination of .dp and CoolMOS will extend the  successful approach into AC to DC applications. We expect the strategy in AC/DC to begin contributing revenues  within 2013 fiscal year.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: All four divisions are expected to be affected by declines with IPC facing the most challenging situation given the  soft demand for capital goods influencing industrial drives and infrastructure projects like traction and renewable  energy. Our other operating segments will also decline as foundry production for our former wireline and wireless  communication businesses continues to phase out.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Operationally, we must manage these challenging times. We have attractive growth potential in the fields of  energy efficiency, mobility and security. Applications such as hybrid vehicles, renewable energies, ever increasing  safety and comfort standards in vehicles and higher efficiency requirements for electrically-powered devices will  drive sustainable demand, growth for power discretes and our growing capabilities in power systems.

file: IFX - Q4 2013 Earnings Call 12November2013 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 12-Nov-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Recall, that with our Dresden 300-millimeter fab alone, if fully built, we would increase our power semiconductor  front-end output by approximately 70% compared to today's capacity. Furthermore, against the backdrop of a 16%  decline in the overall power semiconductor market in calendar year 2012 versus 2011, we were able to capture  market share in both power MOSFETs and IGBT modules.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: And now an important highlight for Automotive. Many of you have, no doubt, seen or heard about BMW's latest  electric vehicle, the i3. I'm proud to announce that through our technical partnership with BMW, multiple  Infineon products are inside the i3, including a HybridPACK 2 IGBT module, TriCore microcontrollers, sensors,  IGBT drivers, and other power devices.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Based on estimates from strategic analytics, the typical electric vehicle has nearly $700 of semiconductor content,  whereas about $320 for a typical car with a combustion engine with approximately 7 5% of the increase in  semiconductor in EVs related to power electronics, such as our HybridPACK IGBT mo dule. As shown by this  example with the i3, given the high Infineon addressable semi content in electric drivetrains and our system  know-how, we are well positioned to benefit from further growth in the EV market.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Moving on to Industrial Power Control; IPC revenues in the September quarter reached €197  million, a notable  improvement over the revenues of €173 million in the June quarter. Industrial drives, wind and solar experienced  the biggest absolute sales increase helped by improving business conditions in China.

file: IFX - Q4 2014 Earnings Call 27November2014 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Nov-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: Now, for the divisional review starting with Automotive. Automotive revenues came in at €518 million, a new all - time high for the division. Light vehicle sales growth remained robust during the quarter in China and the U.S.,  and German OEMs continued to exhibit strength. As a result, our top line for the quarter grew 2% sequentially in  what is normally a seasonal down quarter given fac tories shutdowns over the summer months. Within ATV, body  power products and power MOSFETs experienced yet another quarter of solid growth. These products are  important contributors to reducing CO2 emissions, as an ever-increasing number of functions in the car are using  semiconductors to improve efficiency.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: Renewable energy applications, by contrast, experienced a decline during the quarter driven primarily by wind in  China. The book-to-bill ratio for the quarter softened to 2.8 down from 1.1 and 1.3 in the previous two quarters.  The lower ratio of bookings over billings is primarily this result of developments in China. Number one, build -outs  of manufacturing capacity layer have slowed, weighing on orders for drives products. In addition, ahead of next  year's new five-year plan, there is a caution in solar orders as well.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: Design win activity was also robust during the quarter in our communications business. Most notably, we won  back sockets at a large OEM for RF power amplifiers in the 1.8 gigahertz band and also one new sockets at another  large OEM for RF power amplifier in the 1.9 gigahertz band.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: Next on to Chip Card and Security. CCS revenues amounted to €142 million for the quarter, up $19 million or an  impressive 15% from the prior quarter. Growth was strong across all businesses lines with a significant  contribution yet again from our payment business and increases also in our government ID, pay TV, and trusted  platform sales.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Member of the Management Board, Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: Capital employed stood at €2.452 billion as of the 30th of September 2014, up from €2.327 billion at the end of  June quarter. Please note that our capital employed contains provisions and liabilities related to the Qimonda  insolvency proceedings, the EU antitrust ruling against our CCS division, and put options on our own shares  totaling €438 million. These reduced our capital employed, but should be regarded as non-recurring and  unrelated to our operating business.

texts.speaker: Dominik Asam
texts.profession: Member of the Management Board, Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: Even if adjusted for these items, ROCE amounted to 21% for the fourth quarter, please bear in mind that the level  of provisions and liabilities will drop substantially as of the 31st of December 2014, given the payment of the  antitrust fine of €83 million relating to our CCS division and the payment of €260 million for the settlement with  the Qimonda insolvency administrator during the current quarter. Now back to Reinhard.

file: IFX - Q4 2015 Earnings Call 26November2015 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 26-Nov-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Furthermore, it is also finding its way into consumer applications like Google Tango Project, yet another example  of how we can successfully leverage core technologies to adjacent markets. Let us take a look at Industrial Power  Control. IPC generated revenues of €271 million, essentially flat from €269 million in the previous quarter. In  general, we saw healthy demand in all segments, with some seasonal weaknesses in major home appliances. We  started seeing some signs of a modest recovery in general drives for simple factory automation driven by China's  initiatives to establish manufacturing hubs in the Western part of the country. We remain very bullish on the  prospect of renewable energies as both the momentum in the U.S. continues and the indications are solidifying  that China will mandate even higher installation targets in its forthcoming five-year plan.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: This was not only due to the acquisition of IR, but also due to our success in intelligent power modules from LSPS,  and organic growth of our additional traditional businesses. Besides, I would like to highlight a new product for  electric, commercial and agricultural vehicles. Our new EconoDual module is specifically tailored to the  requirement of this market. We are currently seeing a strong pull from Chinese electric bus makers. Electric buses  are one element in China's effort to improve air quality in urban zones. Although it is still a small segment of the  market today, we are confident that we will see rising demand.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: We continue to see positive momentum in our CCS business. We not only won further business in payment with  key wins in Asia, but also scored another major design win in government identification. A particular success is  winning a major e-transport ticketing project in Barcelona. It features our ticketing solution CIPURSE, the only  open security standard for secure, cost-effective and flexible fare collection solutions. We also broadened our  footprint in IoT security and won further designs. Google just launched a router and smart home hub on Google  OnHub. It uses Infineon's Trusted Platform Module from the OPTIGA TPM family.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: The combination with International Rectifier has made us also stronger in other areas. A very good example is the  DC/DC power stage for next-generation server platforms. This high-performance power stage solution integrates  Infineon's leading low-voltage OptiMOS technology into an application tailored package from International  Rectifier.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chairman of the Management Board & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: The ramping of International Rectifier's intelligent power modules, which are completely to – which are  complementary to ours from LSPS and major home appliances customers, also contributes to incremental  revenue this year. This is an example of adding technology. One of the strengths of International Rectifier is their  fast and flexible approach in serving standard products to broader market.

file: IFX - Q4 2016 Earnings Call 23November2016 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 23-Nov-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Although, Chip Card & Security still faced some inventory overhangs in the payment card market, CCS revenues  came in slightly better than expected with a small quarter-on-quarter increase. Demand from industrial  applications was mixed, resulting in flat revenues quarter-on-quarter.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Now, switching to the megatrend, electrification of the drivetrain; demand remained strong during the quarter.  More importantly, we were extremely successful in acquiring new business for electric drivetrain solutions not only  during the last quarter but also for the entire fiscal year. We secured new design wins in excess of €750 million in  the fiscal year 2016. This includes a major three-digit million business in electric drivetrain based on IGBT  transistors for mass deployment of hybrid and electric vehicles at a leading Tier 1.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let us now turn to Industrial Power. Revenue were essentially flat, coming in with €279 million. In spite of the  reduced feed-in tariffs, the demand for IGBT modules for solar inverters continued to be very high during the  quarter. Major home appliance returned to growth after the inventory overhang in Chinese supply chain was  digested.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let us now take a look at Power Management & Multimarket. Revenues of PMM increased by 5% to €535 million;  €26 million up from €509 million in the June quarter. On average, the power business [indiscernible] (08:37) softer  seasonality than normal, while demand from AC-DC application showed good seasonality, DC-DC application  showed a soft seasonality, remaining essentially flat.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In AC-DC, demand from China for our 650-volt CoolMOS power MOSFETs for xEV charging stations remained  high. In DC-DC, shipments into server platforms remained flat quarter-on-quarter due to the gradual transition  from server platforms VR12.5 to VR13. However, demand for low and medium voltage MOSFETs for DC-DC  power management applications such as brushless DC motors was good.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: We are convinced that we will continue to benefit from strong structural demand drivers, be it electromobility,  ADAS, renewables, power conversions, sensor [ph] in (13:48) smartphones or IoT security, to name a few  examples. We are confident that by capitalizing on these levers, we will be able to continue to deliver the 8%  organic revenue growth set forth in our target financial model in the years to come.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In the current fiscal year, we plan to cover about half of the gap to reach this target. Given the momentum we see  in ramping our unique 300-millimeter thin wafer power fab, we plan to reach the cost crossover by the end of  calendar year 2017 and further benefits from the integration of International Rectifier and the acquisition of  Wolfspeed, we aim to achieve this level shortly thereafter.

file: IFX - Q4 2017 Earnings Call 14November2017 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 14-Nov-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: This quarter's highlight for IPC. First, we see good design win traction for our IGBT Driver IC. Second, revenues  for full silicon carbide modules start coming in both for solar inverters and for ultra-fast charging station for electro  mobility.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: The smartphone component business showed a typical seasonal upswing from the lower base we had reached in  the first half of the fiscal year 2017. The RF power base station business is stable at a low level. In AC-DC, we  saw solid demand across all applications; especially, demand for server power supply remains very solid. In AC- DC, we noted good design win traction for our digital power ICs for lighting and high density SMPS. On top, in  October we announced the first design win for our 600-volt gallium nitride power switch for highly compact 3- kilowatt AC-DC power supplies for data center.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Second, we make progress in optimizing our manufacturing footprint. We are accelerating the ramp-up of our  Dresden 300-millimeter power fab. In principle, we are reaching the cost cross-over to 200-millimeter wafer,  relative to our initial plans early calendar year 2018. However, 300-millimeter wafer costs are increasing faster  than 200-millimeter wafer cost. On top, we are ramping significantly faster due to the booming demand, which  incurs additional unplanned ramp-up costs for 300-millimeter. Moreover, we sold the 200-millimeter legacy facility  in Newport, Wales, while securing capacities through contractual agreement.

file: IFX - Q4 2018 Earnings Call 12November2018 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 12-Nov-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Take xEV in China as an illustration. In September, the total number of cars sold there declined by 10%  compared to 2017. Over the same time, the number of so-called new energy vehicles grew by 55%.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: In Europe, a reduction of the existing CO2 emission targets by 35% until 2030 was => proposed by the EU  secretaries of the environment. Developments like these create ongoing demand for our products and solutions,  evidenced by a book-to-bill ratio of 1.5 at the end of the September quarter.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Moreover, we could record important design wins. A major European Tier 1 selected an Infineon chipset for the  onboard charge of a large European OEM's modular electric drivetrain platform. This award shows the strengths  of our system solutions in different xEV-related applications. It includes an IGBT, a silicon carbide diode, several  power MOSFETs, a system-based chip, and other small signal components.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Industrial Power Control recorded another all-time high quarterly revenue of €361 million, an increase of 3% over  the previous quarter. Year-over-year growth was 10%. In particular, industrial drives, wind, and traction  contributed to this positive development, whereas solar and home appliances remained flat quarter over quarter.  While we steadily expand manufacturing capacity, several product classes continue to be on allocation. The book- to-bill ratio stood at 1.4, unchanged from the prior quarter.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Our product portfolio addresses many different applications, and we benefit from several structural drivers. In  home appliances, the ongoing inverterization increases the content per unit, providing some offset against an  expected seasonal decline in units. In wind power, especially for offshore installations, we can leverage our  expertise in high-power module manufacturing. The same applies to traction, in particular high-speed but also  metropolitan trains. For industrial drives, on the other hand, we currently see a stabilization of demand and  cautiousness leading to higher levels of inventory.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Let's put a spotlight on China, which in total accounts for about half of the segment's revenue. Our exposure to a  number of infrastructure-related initiatives with a long lead time horizon makes us confident about the resilience of  our business in the now running fiscal year and beyond. Train networks are being expanded within and between  cities. The Belt and Road Initiative calls for more and more electrified drive locomotives. The Made in China 2025  program leads to upgrades of factory automation. An increase of the official target for renewables in the overall  energy mix from 20% to 35% by 2030 is in discussion. The deployment of e-buses will be a key measure to limit  pollution in metropolitan areas.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Now a bit more color on the Siltectra acquisition, the company has developed a technology called Cold Split,  which allows to cut silicon carbide crystals very precisely and efficiently, nearly without any losses, especially  compared to sawing.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: This technology can be used in two ways, one, for wafering, which means to cut the boule into wafers, yielding  significantly more wafers than the conventional approach. The other use case is to lift off a very thin layer from the  top of the wafer at the end of the chip manufacturing process and to use the remaining wafer once more. The thin  layer, which contains the active device, is finished applying our special thin wafer technology knowhow. This two- out-of-one concept is very important, as wafer supply will be a limiting factor even longer term, especially when  silicon carbide will ramp in a larger scale in the field of electromobility.

texts.speaker: Reinhard Ploss
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Infineon Technologies AG
texts.text: Siltectra is thus a perfect example of our acquisition strategy, combining strategic financial and cultural fit. We will  work on industrializing Siltectra's technology in the coming years at their site in Dresden and at our fab in Villach.  Over time, further application for the Cold Split technology might emerge, such as boule splitting or the use for  other materials than silicon carbide. To be clear, however, we have no intention to step into the manufacturing of  raw wafers.

texts.speaker: Paul Edgecliffe-Johnson
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, InterContinental Hotels Group Plc
texts.text: Looking now at recyclable investments. We will invest recyclable CapEx when required to support our brand  development and priority markets growth. We have invested $86 million to-date in three hotels and once the brand is established we will look to sell these  properties with a franchise or management contract attached. A typical investment will have holding period of  somewhere between three and five years. And although the focus is on strategic long-term growth of our preferred  brands, we do look for our financial returns to cover the cost of capital during this real-estate investment phase.

texts.speaker: Paul Edgecliffe-Johnson
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, InterContinental Hotels Group Plc
texts.text: We have a strong track record of success in recyclable investments. A good example of this is Staybridge Suites.  This is our homegrown extended-stay brand, which we launched in 1998. We made an initial investment of $228  million to seed the first 19 hotels. And this was mostly recycled by 2003. The brand has grown to almost 300  hotels, and the system and pipeline combined, and generates annual total gross revenues of over $600 million  with no remaining capital invested.

This capital is  intended to support brand development. And although the amount invested will fluctuate year-by-year, over time,  the relative capital intensity of the business will reduce. texts.speaker: Paul Edgecliffe-Johnson
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director
texts.text: We're focused on optimizing our revenue management systems and effective yie ld management of this demand,  which allowed us to increase average rates in the U.S. by 4.2% and allowed the Holiday Inn brand family to  maintain its $5 RevPAR premium to the segment. This generated comparable U.S. RevPAR growth of 5.6% in the  half. From a competitive standpoint, our performance highlights our existing high levels of occupancy and the  distribution of our portfolio towards the oil producing states, such as Texas, Oklahoma and North Dakota, which  were negatively impacted by lower oil prices and resulting industry spend.

texts.speaker: Richard Solomons
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: We've adapted the brand to meet changing consumer needs, rolling out complimentary Wi-Fi to our hotels in  Americas and Europe, enhancing the 24-hour business center and launching a selection of energy-focused food  offerings. Later in the year, we'll begin piloting our unique next generation WorkLife room as we continue  introducing new innovations, which support business productivity.

texts.speaker: Richard Solomons

texts.text: Our Lowest Price Promise is exclusive to IHG Rewards Club members and offers more than price matching. It  promises a price at up to 10% lower than is available anywhere else, and we're so confident in this promise that  we've included a unique price comparison tool on our website for the UK Holiday Inn Express estate.

file: IHGL - Q2 2015 Earnings Call US 30July2015 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Jul-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Paul Edgecliffe-Johnson
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director
texts.text: From a competitive standpoint, our performance highlights our existing high levels of occupancy and the  distribution of our portfolio towards the oil-producing states, such as Texas, Oklahoma and North Dakota, which  were negatively impacted by lower oil prices and resulting industry spend. These three markets represent  approximately 13% of our U.S. portfolio and, together, they delivered flat RevPAR for the half year. Excluding  these markets, our U.S. RevPAR growth would have been 6.5%.

texts.speaker: Richard Solomons
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director
texts.text: And this growth is complemented by a number of new initiatives as we continue the multi-year refresh program  with an emphasis on delivering a great guest experience and making business travel work. texts.text: On a more positive note, last week's official Purchasing Managers Index data for China indicates the return to  growth for the manufacturing sector. file: IHGL - Q4 2017 Earnings Call UK 20February2018 430 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 20-Feb-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Keith Barr
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, InterContinental Hotels Group Plc
texts.text: In order to fund these plans, we're undertaking a comprehensive company-wide efficiency program, which we  started in August of 2017. The program will release $125 million in annual savings across IHG's P&L and system  fund for reinvestment by the end of 2020. Over that period, our disciplined approach to managing our balance  sheet and capital allocation will remain unchanged. We are confident that these actions will enable us to deliver  high quality, long term sustainable growth in cash flows and continue our record for maximizing shareholder  returns.

texts.speaker: Paul Edgecliffe-Johnson
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, InterContinental Hotels Group Plc
texts.text: Looking at the efficiency program on a more granular basis, we expect $50 million of the capacity for reinvestment  to come from savings in our P&L with the remaining $75 million from savings in the system fund. Keith will talk in  more detail about the initiative later. But in broad terms within our P&L, we expect our central functions to realize  around two-thirds of the savings, with the remaining one-third coming from the regions. This capacity will be used  to fund the evolution of our owner proposition and the launch of new brands.

texts.speaker: Paul Edgecliffe-Johnson
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, InterContinental Hotels Group Plc
texts.text: Looking forward, our long-term funding sources are secure, with our first bond maturity not until 2022. We also  have access to a $1.4 billion revolving credit facility for additional cash requirements, of which only $300 million is  currently utilized. Lastly, whether it's further cash available, which is deemed truly surplus, we will return this to  shareholders, as we have demonstrated over the past 14 years. This is all in the context of our commitment to an  investment-grade credit rating. The best external proxy for which is net debt to EBITDA of 2 to 2.5 times. We are  happy to be at the top end of this in the current economic climate.

texts.speaker: Paul Edgecliffe-Johnson
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, InterContinental Hotels Group Plc
texts.text: The efficiency program we are undertaking will free up capacity to reinvest to drive sustained growth into the  future. The costs we will incur to achieve this in 2018 means that the surplus funds we will have available will not  be of a quantum that would justify paying an additional capital return to shareholders this calendar year. But we  remain committed to doing so in the future.

texts.speaker: Keith Barr
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, InterContinental Hotels Group Plc
texts.text: Secondly, owners want low operational costs. We have an owner-centric support structure which allows frequent  and insightful communication. These include our IHG Marketplace purchasing platform and our  IHG Green Engage online sustainability tool.

texts.text: We're on track to meet the cost and the debt reduction targets that we set out in June. texts.text: As a result of our cost saving progress up to March 2013, we announced in May, a material increase in our cost  reduction target for this current financial year to March 2014.
